sentence.Network_en: Her London life was sedate, almost mundane.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在伦敦的生活平淡无奇，几乎有些枯燥。

sentence.Network_en: It was hard to return to mundane matters after such excitement.
sentence.Network_cn: 经验过这种紧张的情形,很难再回来做例行的事务.

sentence.Network_en: I found the job very mundane.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得这工作非常单调.

list.abs: Yael : actually Don , writing was to keep track of more mundane things , like money .事实上，书写创制出来是用来保存更多现世的东西的痕迹，比如说钱。
billowing bustling place mundane world red dust surging in human society 滚滚: roll; billow; surge 红尘: the world of mortals; human.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Old French mondain, from late Latin mundanus, from Latin mundus 'world'. Sense 1 dates from the late 19th cent

entry.def: Something that is mundane is very ordinary and not at all interesting or unusual.

example.ex: Be willing to do even mundane tasks.
example.tran: 即使平凡的工作也乐意承担。

means.word_mean: 1. found in the ordinary course of events;

sentences.sentence: "there's nothing quite like a real...train conductor to add color to a quotidian commute"- Anita Diamant

means.word_mean: 2. concerned with the world or worldly matters;
3. belonging to this earth or world; not ideal or heavenly;

sentences.sentence: "not a fairy palace; yet a mundane wonder of unimagined kind"
